summary: This document contains psychiatric observation notes for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 27-28, 2019, while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details his mental state, physical complaints (numbness, dehydration), sleep disturbances, anxiety about returning to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and his self-reported sensory aversions, including a comparison to autism.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the psychiatric observation notes, detailing his mental state, physical complaints, and conditions while incarcerated at MCC.

persons.name: Nurse Columbo
persons.context: A nurse from the medical unit who examined Epstein for complaints of numbness in his right arm and was notified again about ongoing symptoms.

connections.description: Nurse Columbo provided medical evaluation and care for Epstein's complaints of arm and neck numbness while he was in custody.

events.title: Epstein Interview and Medical Complaint
events.description: Epstein was interviewed, stated he could not remember what caused marks on his neck in SHU, reported severe sleep deprivation, anxiety about returning to SHU, and feeling dehydrated. Medical was contacted about dehydration.

events.title: Epstein's Physical Symptoms and Cell Incident
events.description: Epstein reported ongoing numbness in his right arm and neck. He described a distressing incident where his toilet flushed continuously for 45 minutes, causing extreme agitation and preventing sleep. He was scheduled to be moved to a different cell.

keyFacts: Epstein reported he could not remember what caused marks on his neck while previously held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Epstein claimed severe sleep deprivation, sleeping only about 30 minutes per night for five days prior due to noise in SHU.
Epstein experienced significant physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and reported feeling dehydrated.
A malfunctioning toilet that flushed continuously for 45 minutes caused Epstein extreme distress, likening the noise to his experience in SHU, and led to plans to move him to another cell.
Epstein suggested he 'may have something on the Autism spectrum,' comparing his noise aversion to the character in the movie 'Rain Man.'
